intro: Corynandra elegans, commonly known as the elegant corynandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Corynandra elegans is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
